text: Is any user other than the admin allowed to make transactions, if they're pre-registered, meaning their credentials written in the membersrvc.yaml?

BTW: just quickly. The fact that a “user” has a OTP (one time password) entry in the memberservc.yaml… does not (yet) grant him the permission to deploy/execute a transaction (“automatically”). There are more steps before that:

The entry in the that yaml file, allows the user to register and enroll to the “system”, in a process resulting with an ECert (Enrollment Cert) a TCert (Transaction Cert) that are required in order to transact.
That part of the question is also good for the “cop” channel. I will post it there too in case you need more/relevant details about that part of the flow.

<@U11MANG9G> : Alright, so just to confirm, if `eve` has her credentials in the yaml and I use the hfc to enroll her (since she's already pre-registered), then she should be able to run deploy, invoke and query. Is that correct?
After obtaining an ECert (using the credentials/OTP that is in that tank), TCert...
